```{r setup}
library(testthat)
library(microbenchmark)
library(jeksterslabRlinreg)
context("Test Projection Matrix.")
```


## Parameters


```{r parameters}
n <- 100
sigma2 <- runif(
  n = 1,
  min = 9,
  max = 15
)
beta <- runif(
  n = sample(
    x = 2:5,
    size = 1
  ),
  min = 1,
  max = 3
)
Variable <- c(
  "`n`",
  "`sigma2`",
  "`beta`"
)
Description <- c(
  "Sample size ($n$).",
  "Error variance ($\\sigma^{2}_{\\epsilon}$).",
  "Regression coefficients ($\\beta$)."
)
Value <- c(
  n,
  sigma2,
  paste0(beta, collapse = ", ")
)
knitr::kable(
  x = data.frame(
    Variable,
    Description,
    Value
  ),
  row.names = FALSE
)
```


## Generate Data


```{r generate_data}
X <- matrix(
  data = NA,
  nrow = n,
  ncol = length(beta)
)
for (i in 1:length(beta)) {
  if (i == 1) {
    X[, i] <- rep(
      x = 1,
      times = n
    )
  } else {
    X[, i] <- runif(
      n = n,
      min = -5,
      max = 5
    )
  }
}
y <- X %*% beta + rnorm(
  n = n,
  sd = sqrt(sigma2)
)
```


## Calculate Projection Matrices


```{r estimate}
P <- P(
  X = X
)
M <- M(
  X = X,
  P = NULL
)
M2 <- M(
  X = X,
  P = P
)
```


## Benchmarking


```{r benchmark}
microbenchmark(
  M = M(X = X, P = NULL),
  M2 = M(X = X, P = P)
)
```


## testthat


```{r testthat_01, echo=TRUE}
test_that("M(X = X, P = P) and M(X = X, P = NULL) are equal", {
  expect_equivalent(
    M,
    M2
  )
})
```



```{r testthat_02, echo=TRUE}
test_that("P + M = I", {
  expect_equivalent(
    P + M,
    P + M2,
    diag(nrow(P))
  )
})
```



```{r testthat_03, echo=TRUE}
test_that("Py + My = y", {
  expect_equivalent(
    P %*% y + M %*% y,
    P %*% y + M2 %*% y,
    y
  )
})
```



```{r testthat_04, echo=TRUE}
test_that("PM = 0", {
  expect_equivalent(
    P %*% M,
    P %*% M2,
    matrix(data = 0, nrow = nrow(P), ncol = ncol(P))
  )
})
```
